bug.author: pyunc
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
can not import plotly.express properly <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
1 ) creating a conda env using
try to reproduce this notebook followinf this link https://github.com/shaildeliwala/experiments/blob/master/streamlit.py
What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug:
Go to '...' Click on '....' Scroll down to '....'
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
Explain what you expect to happen when you go through the steps above, assuming there were no bugs. import packaged done <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
if i do not import plotly.express - the streamlit appears in my browser however, when i try to import this error appears in the streamlit browser: ImportError: No module named plotly.express Traceback: File "/home/pauloyun/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/streamlit/ScriptRunner.py", line 311, in _run_script exec(code, module.dict) File "/home/pauloyun/Documentos/model-streamlit/streamlit_101.py", line 3, in import plotly.express as px Explain the buggy behavior you experience when you go through the steps above. If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
That is, did this use to work the way you expected in the past? yes / no <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.51.0 pypi_0 pypi Python version: 3.7 Using Conda? conda OS version: ubuntu 19.04 Browser version: opera
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
If needed, add any other context about the problem here. For exmaple, did this bug come from <denchmark-link:https://discuss.streamlit.io>https://discuss.streamlit.io</denchmark-link> or another site? Link the original source here!

comments.comment: Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pyunc>@pyunc</denchmark-link> , I just tried that experiment and it is working fine for me, looking at your trace seems to be an enviroment problem in which plotly is no correctly installed, please try running streamlint within a new and clean environment or you could try running pip install plotly Let us know if this helps you!
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/pyunc>@pyunc</denchmark-link> Closing this since we did not receive any reply for 14 days. If you still have this problem please don't hesitate to reopen the issue.
